title: 1 person dead, 3 wounded in Stockton shootings
content:
STOCKTON, Calif. (KCRA) —
One victim has died from his gunshot wounds in a Stockton neighborhood while three other shooting victims are reported in stable condition in a hospital, police said.
Officers responded to a report of a shooting around 1:50 a.m. in the area of Poplar and Sutter streets, police said. They found the victim with a gunshot wound, who was pronounced dead at the scene by medics.
As police were investigating the scene, they received a report of three gunshot victims arriving at a hospital, officers said. The victims are described as a 21-year-old man, 20-year-old man and a 17-year-old boy.
Police describe the victim who died from his wounds as a male 15 to 22 year old. He may have recently arrived in Stockton from Humboldt County.
No motive or suspect information has been released regarding the homicide, police said. It is unknown if the shootings are connected.
Anyone with information about this incident is encouraged to contact the Stockton Police Department at 209-937-8377.
